timeline.message: improve handling of popped-out tutorial windows

timeline.bodyText: This feels pretty ugly, but I couldn't find a better way to get notified of a closed child window that worked both in server and desktop sessions.
timeline.author: kevinushey

replies.bodyText:
If you can get it working in server mode, there's a cheat for the desktop: have Qt tell you when a window is closed. This is how we handle closure of source windows.

  
    
      rstudio/src/cpp/desktop/DesktopSatelliteWindow.cpp
    
    
         Line 81
      in
      9679854
    
    
    
    

        
          
           void SatelliteWindow::closeEvent(QCloseEvent *event)
replies.author: jmcphers

timeline.bodyText: This is fine, but could be made more responsive (and avoid polling) by having the tutorial window notify us when it's closed. Is that feasible here? (IIRC we usually do this with something like ShinyDisconnectNotifier, but not sure if that's practical here since we don't wrap the tutorial in a frame we control)
timeline.author: jmcphers

replies.bodyText: Right -- we could just serve a separate page that wraps the tutorial in an <iframe> rather than navigating to the application directly, but that feels more expensive than I'd want to do for this PR.
replies.author: kevinushey
